intro: Ecbolium campestre, commonly known as the field ecbolium, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed areas such as fields and roadsides. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent. Ecbolium campestre is often found in temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia.
